data.enText: if a part of your body is numb , you cannot feel anything in it, for example because of cold
I've just been to the dentist and my face is still numb.
data.chText: 我刚刚去看了牙医，脸上现在还没知觉呢。

data.enText: unable to feel, think or react in the normal way
Her life would never be the same again, she realized numbly.
data.chText: 她模模糊糊地意识到她的生活不会和过去一样了。

data.enText: pain and numbness in my fingers
He was still in a state of numbness and shock from the accident.
data.chText: 由于这事故，他还处于麻木与震惊状态之中。

data.enText: to make a part of your body unable to feel anything, for example because of cold
His fingers were numbed with the cold.
to make sb unable to feel, think or react in a normal way, for example because of an emotional shock
We sat there in silence, numbed by the shock of her death.
data.chText: 我们默默地坐在那里发愣，因为她的死使我们感到震惊。

tr: so frightened as to be unable to move
example: too numb with fear to move

example.ex: He could feel his fingers growing numb at their tips...
example.tran: 他能感到指尖正在变得麻木。

example.ex: My legs felt numb and my toes ached.

value.def: If a part of your body is numb, you cannot feel anything there.

example.ex: I have recently been suffering from pain and numbness in my hands.
example.tran: 我近来双手一直疼痛麻木。

example.ex: The mother, numb with grief, has trouble speaking...
example.tran: 那位母亲因过于悲痛而说不出话来。

example.ex: I was so shocked I went numb.

gramarinfo.label: usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ <l>with</l> n

value.def: If you are numb with shock, fear, or grief, you are so shocked, frightened, or upset that you cannot think clearly or feel any emotion.
value.tran: (因震惊、害怕、悲痛等)失态的，木然的

example.ex: Many men become more aware of emotional numbness in their 40s.
example.tran: 很多男性到了不惑之年以后会愈加意识到自己的情感麻木。

example.ex: He walked numbly into the cemetery.
example.tran: 他糊里糊涂地走进了墓地。

example.ex: For a while the shock of Philippe's letter numbed her...
example.tran: 菲利普来信的打击让她愣了好一会儿。

example.ex: The horror of my experience has numbed my senses.
example.tran: 我经历的那种恐怖已使我感觉迟钝。

value.def: If an event or experience numbs you, you can no longer think clearly or feel any emotion.

example.ex: I'm so numbed with shock that I can hardly think.
example.tran: 我惊呆了，几乎无法思考。

example.ex: ...the sort of numbed hush which usually follows an automobile accident.
example.tran: 通常在车祸之后出现的那种死寂
严寒冻得我的手指都没有知觉了。

example.ex: An injection of local anaesthetic is usually given first to numb the area...
example.tran: 通常先注射局部麻醉药，使该部位失去知觉。

example.ex: She awoke with a numbed feeling in her left leg.

value.def: If cold weather, a drug, or a blow numbs a part of your body, you can no longer feel anything in it.
value.tran: (因天气、药品或重击)使(身体某部位)麻木，使失去知觉
